lexUnit.name: chase.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pursue in order to catch or catch up with.

sentence.text: We are two people chasing the same world title and here we are watching fish together .

We watched for signs of bird activity , because terns and shearwaters congregate whenever small fish shoal near the surface of the sea , and the shoaling is often caused by predatory fish chasing the smaller fish upwards .

He fired his pistol in the air and charged over the top as if he were chasing some errant fox .

Then it abruptly disappeared , and all he could see were entrancing coloured patterns chasing each other about the glowing darkness like tropical fish .
Another time , Alan Slab , who later served a life sentence for murder , chased me across the common in the dark for being cheeky .

The young , untrained dog must have chased them up to the edge of the pit , where they fell to their death .

The mad boy screams as he chases the male nurses down the damp corridors .
